interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

Multiple words are added to the text, including the phrase "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود", which involves more than one word being introduced. This falls under the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which states that if multiple words are added or changed, it belongs to this category.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

Multiple words are added to the text, including the phrase "قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود", which involves more than one word being introduced. This falls under the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which states that if multiple words are added or changed, it belongs to this category.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

[The change involves the omission of the final alif in اتوا, which is a spelling variation that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the definition of orthographic changes, specifically the example of "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود" provided in the earlier examples.]
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

[The entire phrase فكلمهم ايضا يسوع is a major word change because it involves the omission of a complete phrase containing multiple words, but since the root words are significant (كلم, يسوع) and not minor particles, this falls under Single_Major_Word_Change. This is similar to other examples in the provided list like "وقال → OMIT" or "اشهد → OMIT" where a single significant phrase or clause is completely omitted.]
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

[The change involves adding a new word (صوته) before وقال, which means more than one word is being modified. Even though صوته is a minor word (a pronominal suffix), the addition of a word beyond a simple particle or conjunction means this falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category, as per the definition that states "Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category."]
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The change is purely orthographic, involving the variant spelling of the preposition في/فى, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the text. This is similar to other orthographic examples like changing ابرهيم to ابراهيم or اللاه to الاله, where the spelling is modified but the semantic content remains unchanged.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

[The major words الابد and الدهر have different roots, and the pronominal suffix معه is changed to له, which involves a change to a single major word. This matches the example in the Single_Major_Word_Change category where "الدهر بل تكون معه" is changed to "الدهر بل تكون له", which involves changing the pronominal suffix.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

Multiple changes occur: the major word الابد is changed to الدهر, the verb form تكون is changed to يكون, and the pronominal suffix معه is changed to له. Even though some of these changes are minor, the fact that multiple words are modified means this falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category, as per the provided definition.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

[The major word الابد is changed to الدهر, which involves a change in the root word. This is similar to other examples in the Single_Major_Word_Change category where one substantive word is replaced with another, such as changing بيت الكنز to بيت القربان or changing ذريه to بنو.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

[Multiple words are changed: the major word الابد is changed to للدهر, and the pronominal suffix معه is changed to له. Even though each individual change might be minor or major, the fact that more than one word is altered places this in the Multiple_Word_Changes category, as demonstrated by similar examples in the provided list such as "لان ساعته لم → اذ كانت لم" where two words are changed.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The form of the verb تكون is changed to يكون, which is a change in verb form. This falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category as described in the examples, such as "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" where the verb form is modified while maintaining the same root.]
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

[The change involves a substitution of a pronominal suffix (له) with another preposition and pronominal suffix (معه), which falls under the category of minor word changes. The verb form is also changed from يكون to تكون, but since it is a minor change in verb form and only affects a single word, this remains a Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" in the provided list of examples.]
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

[The change involves adding the preposition للدهر, which is a minor word change. The root words remain the same, and only a minor grammatical element (the preposition) is modified. This is similar to other examples in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category like "اتوا اليه → اتوا اليه من" where a preposition is added.]
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The change involves replacing the preposition معه with له, which is a pronominal suffix. This falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category as it involves a change to a minor word (preposition/pronominal suffix) without changing the root of any major words. This is similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" in the provided examples, where a preposition with pronominal suffix is substituted.]
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The major word نور is added to the existing text, changing the meaning substantially. This is a change to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, or particle, and involves adding a major word with a different root meaning. This fits the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to examples like "OMIT → باثامكم" or "فعال ابوكم → فعال ابوكم الشيطان" where a major word is added to the text.]
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

[The word الي is a preposition, which falls under the category of minor words as defined in the Single_Minor_Word_Change description. Adding a preposition is a minor change that does not affect the root of any word or fundamentally alter the meaning of the sentence.]
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي

Even though the spelling change could be considered orthographic, the word order change means this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to other examples in the provided list such as "احرار تكونوا → تكونون احرار" where multiple words are modified.]
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

[The spelling of ايسوع is changed to يسوع, which is a simple orthographic change that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to the example of اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم, which was categorized as an orthographic change.]
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

[The conjunction و is changed to ف, which is a minor word change. This is similar to other examples in the provided list such as "فقال → وقال" or "فلم يمسكه → ولم يمسكه" where the conjunction is modified.]
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

[Multiple words are changed: the verb فقال is replaced with اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم, which involves adding a new verb (اجاب) and changing the word order. This meets the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which includes changes across more than one word, even if the individual changes might be minor.]
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

[The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع, which is a purely orthographic change that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to the example of اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم in the provided examples of orthographic changes.]
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

Even though the individual changes might seem minor, because multiple words are affected, this falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category, as demonstrated by similar examples in the provided list such as "ليس ادين احد → فليس ادين احدًا" which shows multiple simultaneous changes.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

This is a pure orthographic change, similar to the example in the provided list: "ليس ادين احدا → ليس ادين احد" and "فليس ادين احدًا → فليس ادين احدا".]
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The change is simply the removal of the diacritical mark (tanwin/nunation) on احد, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the definition of orthographic changes that involve diacritics and do not impact the word's meaning.]
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد
